captions.text: - Oh, no, Gaby's party, oh shit.
I hate parties, I'm not gonna know anyone,

everyone's gonna wonder
who the hell is this?

- Is it just me, or did it
just get desperate in here?
- Who would hang out with her... it?
she's so sweet, she's so funny.
- Hi, oh, my God, so good to see you!
- Can I get you a drink?

Why did I say sure, I won't
be able to drive home.
- I think we got a booze around here?
- Can I actually just have water?

- Oh, no, now I have
to go to the bathroom,
and the line's gonna be so long.
I'm gonna have to make chit chat
- Yes, oh, my God, Allison, hi!
- Oh, my God, you don't remember me.
- I'm just, I'm sorry, I'm just really bad
- Oh, yeah, I know you guys!
- Come on, don't try to fake it.

- Is that Nick with a
new girlfriend already?

- Oh, Shy, this is Allison,
she and I used to hang out.

- Actually I'm glad you're
here because I really miss you

and I thought maybe we
could talk about us.
- Oh, my God, is this Allison?
- Yeah, Shy, Allison, this is my cousin.
- So nice to finally meet you.
I have been wanting to call you so much.
Do you want to step out and maybe--

- Actually I have to get
a drink, so I'll see ya.

You know, I'm glad that
I came to this party.
I had a lot of fun.

I think I made some
friends, but I'm tired,
Hey, I think I'm gonna head out.
You're not even gonna stay on my birthday?

- I'm surprised she
even knows who you are.
just walking around, talking to everyone.
- Okay, I'll just let myself out.
I knew this night would be horrible.

title: Your Paranoid Thoughts At A Party

comments.text:
I don't do parties because I looooooove to sleep, so I need to sleep early, 
so when I go to a party, at 10 or 11 p.m I'm asking my friend for some a 
place to sleep :) ﻿

comments.text:
My fear vs reality always seem to stay in line with eachother. As soon as I 
think there is a little hope something squishes it. My anxiety has led to 
an understandable distance from & by others. On one end I feel hurt... but 
on the other Im slightly relieved I don't have to worry about "hanging out" 
seeing how I'm so bad at it.﻿

comments.text:
This IS how it feels to live with social anxiety. You are constantly 
playing out scenarios in your head and worrying about things that generally 
don't need to be stressed, but at the same time social anxiety can be 
brought on by fear from past experiences that may induce anxiety in the 
current moment.  ﻿

comments.text:
Unfortunately I am plagued with these paranoid thoughts and this video was 
super stressful because I felt so relieved every time her thoughts were 
proven wrong and then it ended with everyone acting how she expected them 
to before and it freaked me out to think that my irrational social fears 
might actually happen one day and not just be me thinking things up in my 
head. ﻿

You know it's weird, I have social anxiety but I love being around people. 
I hate being by myself for long periods of time because it makes me feel

stupid, no one is going to want to be around me.﻿

comments.text:
LOL  Back in the 80's I got invited to a lot of big parties. Kinna went

stand in the corner, watching. Don't be aggressively friendly.  Let people 
talk to YOU﻿

comments.author: Travis Fyfe

comments.text:
This is too true. Especially the first one I show up to parties alone and 
I'm pretty sure everyone just turns to see me and think "is he even in the 
right place he must be lost" and then I hopelessly wait for my friend to 
pop around the corner and save me from feeling awkward. And then when I'm 
talking to strangers and I'm just mumbling under my breath or talking into 
my cup and smiling awkwardly like I'm sure they're thinking "he must be 
stuck up and an asshole" but in my mind i want you to keep talking to me 
I'm just shy and weird sorry :( ﻿
comments.author: El Toro

comments.text: this is why i only parti with ponies﻿
comments.author: Sparkle Butt

comments.text:
*Hey* *guys,* *please* *tell* *me* *if* *I'm* *an* *introvert* *of* *just* 
*shy*? I hate it when friends invite me outside for something. I love 
hanging out with them in my university. But when I'm out of university. I 
just like to be home. I ignore all their messages and phone calls and make 
excuses when I meet them in school. But now they have pretty much figured 
out. When I'm with my friends I'm usually very active and very casual. We 
do enjoy each others company. I do avoid parties as well like 70% of the 
time. So maybe two get together in a month is a maximum. I do like hanging 
out with my girlfriend though more than others. But even she knows that a 
lot of the day I just want to be home with myself.﻿
comments.author: TheLowsofSolipsism

comments.text:
I would say that you are an introvert with the fact that you said "I just 
want to be home with myself". Although it could be a little bit of both if 
i knew more about you. I believe there are other things that play a factor 
into how you are though. You don't have to answer on here but Why do you 
hate when your friends invite you out? and is it out to go bowling(for 
example) or to a party? and does that make a difference in how you view it? 
Also when they invite you out are you thinking about negative things that 
could happen such as how awkward or weird thing could be?(i do that) or are 
you thinking about positive things like much fun you could have and 
different cool things that could happen. Just some things to think about 
that i think might help you.
comments.author: KingDunn13
